alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 05 at 5:48AM CDT until May 05 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma... Southern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... Northwestern Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma... Southern Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma... South Central Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 800 AM CDT. * At 548 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen overnight and an additional inch are possible in the warned area through 8 AM. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stilwell... Eufaula... Henryetta... Checotah... Warner... Vian... Weleetka... Gore... Webbers Falls... Oktaha... Marble City... Braggs... Hanna... Rentiesville... Stidham... Keefeton... Greenleaf State Park... Pumpkin Center... Lake Tenkiller State Park... Lake Eufaula State Park... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Sequoyah
